definitions.definition: move or cause to move in a particular direction by turning over and over on an axis.
examples: the car rolled down into a ditch
synonyms: rotate "the bottle rolled down the table"

definitions.definition: turn or cause to turn over to face a different direction.
examples: she rolled onto her side

definitions.definition: turn (one's eyes) upward, typically to show surprise or disapproval.
examples: Sarah rolled her eyes

definitions.definition: (of a person or animal) lie down and turn over and over while remaining in the same place.
examples: the buffalo rolled in the dust

definitions.definition: (of a moving ship, aircraft, or vehicle) rock or oscillate around an axis parallel to the direction of motion.
examples: the ship pitched and rolled

definitions.definition: move along or from side to side unsteadily or uncontrollably.
examples: they were rolling about with laughter

definitions.definition: overturn (a vehicle).
examples: he rolled his Mercedes in a 100 mph crash

definitions.definition: throw (a die or dice).
obtain (a particular score) by doing this.
examples: roll a 2, 3, or 12

definitions.definition: (of a vehicle) move or run on wheels.
examples: the van was rolling along the highway

definitions.definition: move or push (a wheeled object).
examples: Pat rolled the cart back and forth

definitions.definition: make a car window or a window blind move up or down.
(of time) elapse steadily.
examples: the years rolled by

definitions.definition: (of a drop of liquid) flow.
examples: huge tears rolled down her cheeks

definitions.definition: (of a product) issue from (an assembly line or machine).
examples: the first copies of the newspaper rolled off the presses

definitions.definition: (of waves, smoke, cloud, or fog) move or flow forward with an undulating motion.
examples: the fog rolled across the fields

definitions.definition: (of land) extend in gentle undulations.
(of credits for a movie or television program) be displayed as if moving on a roller up the screen.
(with reference to a machine, device, or system) operate or begin operating.
examples: the cameras started to roll

definitions.definition: start moving; take action.
examples: the coast's clear—let's roll

definitions.definition: behave in a particular way.
examples: that's just how I roll, guys—I'll smile until I physically can't

definitions.definition: turn (something flexible) over and over on itself to form a cylinder, tube, or ball.
examples: she started to roll up her sleeping bag
synonyms: curl; twist "he rolled his handkerchief into a ball"

definitions.definition: make by forming material into a cylinder or ball.
examples: Harry rolled himself a joint

definitions.definition: (of a person or animal) curl up tightly.
examples: the shock made the armadillo roll into a ball

definitions.definition: flatten or spread (something) by using a roller or by passing it between rollers.
examples: roll out the dough on a floured surface
synonyms: level (out); even out "roll out the pastry"

definitions.definition: (of a loud, deep sound such as that of thunder or drums) reverberate.
examples: the first peals of thunder rolled across the sky

definitions.definition: pronounce (a consonant, typically an r ) with a trill.
examples: when he wanted to emphasize a point he rolled his rrrs

definitions.definition: utter (a word or words) with a reverberating or vibratory effect.
examples: he rolled the word around his mouth

definitions.definition: (of words) flow effortlessly or mellifluously.
examples: the names of his colleagues rolled off his lips

definitions.definition: rob (someone, typically when they are intoxicated or asleep).
examples: if you don't get drunk, you don't get rolled

definitions.definition: a cylinder formed by winding flexible material around a tube or by turning it over and over on itself without folding.
examples: a roll of carpet

definitions.definition: a cylindrical mass of something or a number of items arranged in a cylindrical shape.
examples: a roll of mints

definitions.definition: an item of food that is made by wrapping a flat sheet of pastry, cake, meat, or fish around a sweet or savory filling.
examples: salmon and rice rolls

definitions.definition: money, typically a quantity of banknotes rolled together.
examples: wad, bundle a roll of $20 bills

definitions.definition: a roller for flattening something, especially one used to shape metal in a rolling mill.
a movement in which someone or something turns or is turned over on itself.
examples: a roll of the dice

definitions.definition: a gymnastic exercise in which the body is rolled into a tucked position and turned in a forward or backward circle.
examples: a forward roll

definitions.definition: a swaying or oscillation of a ship, aircraft, or vehicle around an axis parallel to the direction of motion.
examples: the car corners capably with a minimum of roll

definitions.definition: undulation of the landscape.
examples: hidden by the roll of the land was a refinery

definitions.definition: a prolonged, deep, reverberating sound, typically made by thunder or a drum.
examples: thunder exploded, roll after roll

definitions.definition: one of the basic patterns (rudiments) of drumming, consisting of a sustained, rapid alternation of single or double strokes of each stick.
a very small loaf of bread, typically eaten with butter or a filling.
examples: a sausage roll

definitions.definition: an official list or register of names.
examples: list, register, directory, record, file, index, catalog, inventory, address book; census the electoral roll

definitions.definition: the total numbers on an official list of names.
examples: a review of secondary schools to assess the effects of falling rolls

definitions.definition: a document, typically an official record, in scroll form.
